page.title: 13 THE OLD JAIL
page.content: Outside the old Estate house there is a jail. It is a little round building with a pointed roof. It is made of snecked stone with dressed stone round the windows which are iron with bars in. The roof is lead and conical shaped. The walls and roof are three metres high. There is a carved wooden spike on the top. You cannot see the door of the jail from the road because it is behind a wall.We peeped round the corner expecting to see someone but there was no one.We slashed down the nettles and went in. The middle of the roof has fallen in. There is some straw above resting on rotten wooden beams. There were cracked plaster walls. Inside it smells of pipe smoke.
